   6.

107.sentence_1: The only situation you should touch your dog in (apart from giving him a tranquilizer, as discussed below) is if he is in danger.
107.sentence_2: The only situation you should touch your dog in (apart from giving him a tranquilizer, as discussed below) is if he is in danger and <his fit will lead to physical injury>.
107.context_before:
He will not know what he is doing and bite down and not release your hand until the fit is over. It is both unnecessary and unwise to take this risk. 
 *
107.context_after: If he is seizuring at the top of a flight of stairs, for example, then it is best to risk moving him and quietly slide him along the ground to a place of safety.  5. Take a video. Once you have done everything you can do to aid your dog's recovery, shoot a short video film of the seizure event on your smart phone. This is helpful to your vet because not everything that looks like a seizure is actually a true seizure.

108.sentence_1: Look under rocks, and old things that have been just sitting there.
108.sentence_2: Look under rocks, and old things that have been just sitting there or <your driveway>.
